purpose: Canonical course identity mapping for cross-term trend tracking when course subject codes change (e.g., CSCD -> CYBR) or when courses are cross-listed under multiple subjects.

entries.notes: Requested special-case: CYBR 330 was historically offered as CSCD 330. Treat as one course for longitudinal reporting.
Same number/title across subjects and appears as a Banner crossList group in some terms.
NETWORK SECURITY appears under both CSCD and CYBR in schedule snapshots.
SECURE CODING appears under both CSCD and CYBR in schedule snapshots.
SENIOR PROJECT appears under both CSCD and CYBR in schedule snapshots.
SENIOR CAPSTONE appears under both CSCD and CYBR in schedule snapshots.
INTERNSHIP appears under both CSCD and CYBR in schedule snapshots.
NETWORK SECURITY (500-level) appears under both CSCD and CYBR in schedule snapshots.
SECURE CODING (500-level) appears under both CSCD and CYBR in schedule snapshots.
THESIS appears under both CSCD and CYBR in schedule snapshots.
RESEARCH REPORT / GRADUATE RESEARCH REPORT appears under both CSCD and CYBR in schedule snapshots.
